showScoreExcerpt:
“Director Michael Grief moves the proceedings along at a steady pace but is unable to overcome the pitfalls of script. Adding fourteen musical numbers and four reprises to a storyline reduces the time necessary to develop the depth of these intense characters and situations. The timeline moves at lightning speed, from first date and first drink to disintegrating marriage and raging alcoholic with no time to examine why this happens.”

Read more
